attributes.comment:
We have one daughter adopted from China and are waiting to bring home our second
daughter. We have to file for a certificate of citizenship for both daughters
since my husband is unable to travel. With these new fees, this will cost us
nearly $1000 just to receive this piece of paper, that other families where both
parents travel receive for free. I thought it was expensive enough at $220, but
you are looking to more than double this fee. Adoption is expensive enough and
families feel as if we are being penalized because we chose to adopt a precious
child from another country.

Please reconsider this fee increase!! Most families struggle to raise the funds
for the adoption and then to have to return home and pay this additional fee is
so hard!

To receive the 171-H form for our first adoption cost about $100 less than the
2nd time around, and that was only 2 years difference!! These are just people
trying to build a family! Our own government shouldn't be trying to make huge
profits on this. There is very little time involved in processing these forms
and yet you want to raise the cost.

PLEASE reconsider!!!!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kristi S. Foster
